TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit TableRow extends System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl

Docs.summary: Represents a row in a control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In this topic: - [Introduction](#introduction) - [Declarative Syntax](#declarative_syntax) ## Introduction The class represents a row in a control. This class allows you to control how the contents of the row are displayed. The alignment of the contents in the row are specified by setting the and properties. You can programmatically manage the cells in the row by using the collection. The collection is a collection of objects that represent the cells in the row. > [!CAUTION] > The control can be used to display user input, which might include malicious client script. Check any information that is sent from a client for executable script, SQL statements, or other code before displaying it in your application. ASP.NET provides an input request validation feature to block script and HTML in user input. Validation server controls are also provided to assess user input. For more information, see [ASP.NET Validation Controls](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/fa2aa14d-a461-492e-9a79-c990904613ef). ## Declarative Syntax ```                   ``` ## Examples This following code example creates a table, programmatically adds elements to the table, and displays the table on the Web page. [!code-aspx-csharp[TableCell#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/TableCell/CS/tablecellcs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[TableCell#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/TableCell/VB/tablecellvb.aspx#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of objects that represent the cells of a row in a control.
Docs.value: A object that represents a collection of cells from a row of a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this property to programmatically control a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell> objects that represent the cells from a row of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> control. You can programmatically add, insert, or remove a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell> object from the collection.
> [!NOTE] > This property is only used when building <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> controls programmatically. At design time, this property is set by declaring <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell> objects.
## Examples This following code example creates a table, programmatically adds elements to the table, and displays the table on the Web page.
[!code-aspx-csharp[TableCell#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/TableCell/CS/tablecellcs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[TableCell#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/TableCell/VB/tablecellvb.aspx#1)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow.CreateControlCollection%2A> method creates a new <xref:System.Web.UI.ControlCollection> object that holds the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow> cells.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow.CreateControlCollection%2A> method is primarily of interest to control developers extending the functionality of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow> control.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal alignment of the contents in the row.
Docs.value: One of the values. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow.HorizontalAlign%2A> property to specify the horizontal alignment of the contents of the row. The following table lists the possible values.
|Horizontal Alignment|Description| |--------------------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HorizontalAlign.NotSet>|The horizontal alignment is not set.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HorizontalAlign.Left>|The contents of the row are left justified.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HorizontalAlign.Center>|The contents of the row are centered.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HorizontalAlign.Right>|The contents of the row are right justified.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HorizontalAlign.Justify>|The contents of the row are uniformly spread out and aligned with both the left and right margins.|
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow.HorizontalAlign%2A> property. For a complete, working code example, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow> class overview topic.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the control should set the attribute of the rendered HTML element to "disabled" when the control's property is .
Docs.value: if the property indicates an ASP.NET version lower than 4.0; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property indicates how ASP.NET should render HTML for a control when the control is disabled. If this property is `true`, ASP.NET renders a `disabled` attribute when a control is disabled. If this property is `false`, ASP.NET renders a `class` attribute when a control is disabled. For more information, see <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.SupportsDisabledAttribute%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>.

Docs.related: Table, TableRow, and TableCell Web Server Control Overview

member this.TableSection : System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRowSection with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the location for a object in a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow.TableSection%2A> property to get or set where the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow> object is placed in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> control. For the available table locations, see <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRowSection>. The following table lists the possible values.
|Table row section|Displayed as| |-----------------------|------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRowSection.TableHeader>|The header row.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRowSection.TableBody>|The body of the table.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRowSection.TableFooter>|The footer row.|
When using the declarative syntax, the sections must be in the order of header, body, and then footer.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRowSection> enumeration enables you to build accessible Web sites using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> control by adding the `<thead>`, `<tbody>`, and `<tfoot>` elements to the HTML that is rendered to the client. If all rows in a table are in the `<tbody>` element, the section information is not rendered. At least one row must be in a non-body element.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow.TableSection%2A> property to define header and footer rows in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> control.
[!code-aspx-csharp[TableRow#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/TableRow/CS/TableRowCS.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[TableRow#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/TableRow/VB/TableRowVB.aspx#1)]

Docs.related: Table, TableRow, and TableCell Web Server Control Overview

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the vertical alignment of the contents in the row.
Docs.value: One of the values. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow.VerticalAlign%2A> property to specify the vertical alignment of the contents of the row. The following table lists the possible values.
|Vertical Alignment|Description| |------------------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.VerticalAlign.NotSet>|The vertical alignment is not set.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.VerticalAlign.Top>|The contents of the row are aligned with the top of the row.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.VerticalAlign.Middle>|The contents of the row are aligned with the middle of the row.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.VerticalAlign.Bottom>|The contents of the row are aligned with the bottom of the row.|
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow.VerticalAlign%2A> property. For a complete, working code example, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow> class overview topic.
